intro: Cyrtandra coacta, commonly known as the Hawaiian mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Cyrtandra coacta is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and stream banks. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, supporting various pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of the region.
